messages.message:
I’ve noticed a breaking change in toasts while doing enterprise UATs

In `@instabase.com/toast`, loading toasts never automatically disappear. This is intended so that the user is aware that an operation is ongoing. The loading toast can disappear if (1) the user closes it, (2) the same toast id is used for a success or error toast, or (3) the loading toast was set as low-priority https://github.com/instabase/javascript-packages/tree/main/packages/toast#toast-config

In Pollen, loading toasts do automatically disappear after a timeout - is this intended? @Xindi Xu @Liam Callanan
another breaking change is that the `toastId` isn’t used in `data-testid`, which broke some Cypress tests, which are mostly fixed now
I can change that behavior in Pollen, I think it makes sense like it does with errors defaulting to high priority
